bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 84 (Tuesday, May 5, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. YOUNG:H.R. 6734.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1, Clause 3, and Clause 18 ofthe Constitution.[Page H1980]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E427)

summary.text:
Eco-Tourism Vessel Equity and Relief Act of 2020

This bill directs the Department of Homeland Security to prescribe a tonnage measurement as a small passenger vessel for the M/V LISERON (U.S. official number 971339) for purposes of applying an optional regulatory measurement.

bill.title: Eco-Tourism Vessel Equity and Relief Act of 2020

item.title: Eco-Tourism Vessel Equity and Relief Act of 2020
To deem the vessel M/V LISERON to be less than 100 gross tons, as measured under chapter 145 of title 46, United States Code, and for other purposes.
Eco-Tourism Vessel Equity and Relief Act of 2020

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
